channel.title: Why all the labels?
channel.description: I'm just a bit confused why everyone's making "labels", except for maybe 1 or 2, they don't seem needed. anyone know where and why the spike in label creation happened?

item.title: Why all the labels?
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
So, anyway, another one bites the dust.

Bottom line is if you wanna make a collective or label, whatever, go for it. People will either listen, or won’t!

Read full topic

item.title: Why all the labels?

item.description: Read full topic

item.title: Why all the labels?
item.dc:creator: anon73773654
item.description:
okkkkk

could i please make something clear?

there are two types of labels people are talking about here, and most aren’t specifying which:

small labels created by auxy members (but not auxy-only) and professional labels from outside of the community.

examples:
frontier, vvvvv, melo;
preconceived notions, future vibes, cosmic superior, lunch box, destinuna, phuture collective, night owl collective, delimited, ridgeline, etc.

one main thing I’m noticing is confusing a lot of people is which daws they accept; and the answer is, both kinds of labels accept all daws.

second: yes, i agree, some labels started by people here don’t get a lot of promo compared to others. so what? frontier gets an average of about 500 which is definitely something to aim to for about half the people here. it means frontier can search for underrated and talented submissions that they can release to their page.

lotsa people think: huh? why can’t i post it on my page? well, labels do the promo for you, which is the good part. it also does the artwork for you, and many release it to stores on your behalf as well.

members of the community here for some reason seem to not be liking labels, and I’m not sure i understand why… i think it’s a misunderstanding.

another main point: many seemingly “small” labels do a lot of promotion. phuture collective helps melo/some other labels with promotion by reposting on their accounts.

bottom line: if you think releasing on a small label isn’t helpful, you don’t have to! there is literally nothing wrong with like the 3-4 labels for underrated producers.

they’re stepping stones to get accepted into bigger labels. trust me, doing that is a process; reverie was in the making for a month and a half and took another month to make edits to get released.

thank you for reading this; i hope it straightened things out for everyone!

Read full topic

item.title: Why all the labels?
item.dc:creator: NickElle
item.description:
How do you figure?

I’ll give you an example.
I LOVE delay and reverb.
Like HEAVY amounts of it.
Auxy can’t do that. It only has limited control over such things.

Also, the sounds that come with it are to bright for me. Yes, you can use filters, but there’s no ADSR control, there’s no sound design capabilities what so ever.

But, that being said, some of the Future Bass, and other EDMish and Popish genres are great!
I don’t really care for them, myself, but they’re made very well, and they sound professional.

Read full topic

item.title: Why all the labels?
item.dc:creator: stereofield
item.description:
NickElle:

Nope, it totally doesn’t mean Auxy makes bad music.
It just means Auxy can’t actually produce the music I like.

That is the same thing

Read full topic

item.title: Why all the labels?
item.dc:creator: NickElle
item.description:
There’s a bunch more.
For instance, IVO, Xer… uh… that guy with X in his name, and myself.
Also, I’m not trying to sound like a broken record, but my label is LITERALLY not Auxy music.
I’ve had it since before I used Auxy, and i rarely use Auxy anymore.
Also, my label’s genres don’t fit the music being spit out from the 1/8 jack of Auxy.

Read full topic

item.title: Why all the labels?
item.dc:creator: Zeph
item.description:
I will apologize in advance if you feel targeted, but this is just my brutal honesty. The way I see it, people who are frankly unskilled enough to get their music accepted by established labels, or reposted by Auxy, etc., feel the need to self gratify themselves because they want mOrE rEcOgNiTIon. So they unify with other people who feel the same and make useless labels. In the end, they just make a big circlejerk of musicians who know each other. Of course, this does not apply to everyone and everything, this is just what I have observed in this community.

Read full topic

item.description:
Actually, VVVVV only has one full-time Auxy user on their team. Surf doesn’t use Auxy anymore, Josh kind of does, and Kro stopped music… We don’t want to be associated with the Auxy community as a whole but we do accept songs made in Auxy.

item.title: Why all the labels?
item.dc:creator: El1011
item.description:
TheRealJFalc:

Preconceived Notion

is that label under a different name? can’t seem to find it (at least on soundcloud)

TheRealJFalc:

this category

category of a what? an auxy community channel or diverse channel?

.

TheRealJFalc:

still progress that can be made

agreed (as well as with the Frontier bit). Personally, i think something to help would be release on different platforms such as Youtube or Spotify. Soundcloud is great if you know who you’re looking for, but stumbling upon something like Frontier, especially given the following they currently have, (no offense to anyone) is pretty rare.

Read full topic

item.title: Why all the labels?
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
I don’t think Preconceived Notion and Cosmic Superior fall under this category, and we’ve had @anon73773654 and @blackocean release songs through them.

I do agree though that the smaller labels through this community need to have a stronger outreach, but I’d definitely say Frontier has that well under control. As for the others, there’s still progress that can be made for the future.

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: Why all the labels?
item.dc:creator: El1011
item.description:
i’m pretty on board with what @NickElle’s saying here. Regardless if the labels or even the repost channels are being auxy exclusive or not, all of the releases are from people within the auxy community.

I like the labels and think it’s good to get yourself known in the community, but outside of that, there’s not much else to be gained. I think you would have a better chance at reaching new communities and gain a bigger following by releasing with a label outside of the auxy community. I’m not saying you have to go big and try to release with Monstercat, NCS, or something of the sort. But i think even if you were to get a release with a smaller label like Magnifiedspoiler you would be able to build up a more diverse fanbase

Read full topic
